descript.abstract: Polygon layer representing tax parcels in Itasca County. Right-of-Ways are incorporated into the parcels. All of the tax information and the parcel number are duplicated in the right-of-way portion. The polycode field should be used to isolate only tax parcels for tax information analysis. Redundant geometries exist for condominiums and undivided interests. Undivided ownership occurs when two or more parties have an interest in the same parcel. This becomes important in analysis as well. The acres and tax information reflects the entire parcel, not the undivided interest portion.
descript.purpose: The parcel base map is vital in supporting property and land record operations of Itasca County.

theme.themekey: planningCadastre, Parcel, Cadastre, Property Boundary, Land Ownership, Ownership

cntperp.cntorg: Itasca County Department of Surveying and Mapping

dataqual.complete: Itasca County parcel mapping is complete, with the exception of: T14728W, T14628W, Reginawood Plat and Kaynosh Beach Plat.

procstep.procdesc: Survey grade GPS coordinates and private survey information are processed in the StarNet Adjustment program. From this information the accurate PLS coordinates are obtained. The PLS coordinates are used in ArcGIS Desktop to subdivide all of the sections in a particular township. After the section is subdivided, coordinate geometry is used to add the parcels from the assessor's legal descriptions. The Parcel geometry is joined with tabular tax information from the Assessor's and Auditor's department to create this layer.

attracc.attraccr: The parcel number (PIN) and poly_code are manually entered by the Surveyor's office. Database comparisons are made between the PIN and the tax database from the Assessor's / Auditor's office. An attempt is made to have a one to one match in both databases, however, some property descriptions cannot be mapped because of poor legal descriptions. Attributes such as owner, market value, address, etc. are not produced or managed by the Department of Surveying and Mapping, (DSM), and therefore have not been verified by the Itasca County Department of Surveying and Mapping.

dataqual.logic: GIS software checks are preformed for topology consistency during the parcel mapping process. This ensures there are no duplicate lines, gaps, overlaps, undershoots, or overshoots. Where ambiguity in property line locations exist, the lines are merged into a single line if the distance between lines is three feet or less. If the distance between lines exceeds three feet, the gap or overlap is drawn and noted with a POLY_CODE of 90.

horizpa.horizpar: Section corner and Quarter corner locations are within +- 3 feet with a 90% confidence.

edom.edomvd: Omitted Land (Upland on the lakeside of a meander line)

attr.attrdef: Key field which links to the tax information table and the undivided relate table
Unique number for the Tax Payer
PLSS Section the property is located in
PLSS Township the property is located in
PLSS Range the property is located in
Shortened Legal description from the Assessor's office
MnDNR lake number of adjoining lake
Estimated Land Value From the Assessor's Office
Estimated Structure Value From the Assessor's Office
Estimated Market Value From the Assessor's Office
House Number from the Physical Address
